intro: Ptisana salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf ptisana, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of willow trees. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are typically pollinated by wind. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Ptisana salicifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
